abstract: Public health advocates and environmentalists are disappointed by major smog regulation unveiled by Obama administration, saying it falls short of their hopes for stricter restrictions on emissions; Environmental Protection Agency regulation is nevertheless significantly stronger than Bush-era standards.
lead_paragraph: The new rule, set at the weakest standard in the range recommended by scientists, suggests that industry groups were successful in lobbying the White House.

headline.main: New Limit for Smog-Causing Emissions Isn’t as Strict as Many Had Expected
headline.print_headline: New Limit on Smog-Causing Emissions Is Not as Strict as Expected

snippet: The new rule, set at the weakest standard in the range recommended by scientists, suggests that industry groups were successful in lobbying the White House.
